text: New Hampshire's 15th State Senate district is one of 24 districts in the New Hampshire Senate. It has been represented by Democrat Dan Feltes since 2014; Feltes is running for governor in 2020, and thus not seeking re-election. ==Geography== District 15 is based in the state capitol of Concord, also covering the Merrimack County towns of Henniker, Hopkinton, and Warner. The district is located entirely within New Hampshire's 2nd congressional district. ==Recent election results== ===2020=== ===2018=== ===2016=== ===2014=== ===2012=== ==Historical election results== The following result occurred prior to 2012 redistricting, and thus were held under different district lines. ===2010=== ===Federal and statewide results in District 15=== {| class=wikitable |- ! width="30" | Year ! width="60" | Office ! width="180" | Results |- | 2016 | President | align="right" | Clinton 58.0 – 36.7% |- | rowspan="2" | 2014 | Senate | align="right" | Shaheen 65.3 – 34.7% |- | Governor | align="right" | Hassan 65.8 – 34.2% |- | rowspan="2" | 2012 | President | align="right" | Obama 63.6 – 35.3% |- | Governor | align="right" | Hassan 65.9 – 31.9% |} ==References== 15 Category:Merrimack County, New Hampshire
title: New Hampshire's 15th State Senate District
